subject: Politics
title: Can Change Be Peaceful
description: A short lesson to help you apply Can Change Be Peaceful.

hook.text: Violent revolution gets the movies. Peaceful transitions get results. The boring path works more often.

buildup.text: Negotiated transitions â€” like Spain's move from dictatorship to democracy in the 1970s â€” avoid bloodshed.

discovery.text: Gradual reform within existing systems changed women's rights, labor laws, and civil rights without revolution.

twist.text: Peaceful change requires powerful people to give up power voluntarily. That's rare and usually needs pressure.

climax.text: The best changes combine pressure from below with reform from above. Streets and parliaments working together.

punchline.text: Peaceful change is possible. It just requires patience, pressure, and courage.

quiz.question: What combination tends to produce the most successful peaceful change?
options: Pressure from below combined with reform from above
Only top-down government decisions without public input
